chart.title: Per capita electricity generation by source
chart.subtitle: Measured in [kilowatt-hours](#dod:watt-hours). "Other renewables" include geothermal, tidal, and wave generation.
chart.citation: Ember (2025); Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025); Population based on various sources (2024)

Coal electricity per capita - kWh (adapt.titleShort: Electricity generation from coal per person
Coal electricity per capita - kWh (adapt.titleLong: Electricity generation from coal per person
descriptionKey: Per capita figures are calculated by dividing total values by the population of the country or region. Population data is constructed by Our World in Data, based on [various sources](https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/population).
Coal electricity per capita - kWh (adapt.descriptionProcessing: - While the Energy Institute (EI) provides a longer time series (dating back to 1965) than Ember (dating back only to 1990 for European countries and 2000 for other countries), EI does not cover all countries or all sources of electricity (for example, generation from bioenergy is missing). Therefore, when data from Ember is available for a given country and year, we use it as the primary data source. Where Ember data is unavailable, we supplement it with data from EI.
Coal electricity per capita - kWh (adapt.citationShort: Ember (2025); Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025); Population based on various sources (2024) – with major processing by Our World in Data
Coal electricity per capita - kWh (adapt.citationLong: Ember (2025); Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025); Population based on various sources (2024) – with major processing by Our World in Data. “Electricity generation from coal per person” [dataset]. Ember, “Yearly Electricity Data Europe”; Ember, “Yearly Electricity Data”; Energy Institute, “Statistical Review of World Energy”; Various sources, “Population” [original data].
